intro: Hieracium jurassicum subsp. adenocalathium, commonly known as the Jurassic hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems, typical of the genus Hieracium. The subspecies is native to parts of Europe and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. It has small, alternate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected plant in some regions.
